flawed_nl_solution:
Lee currently earns $60000 / 12 months = $<<60000/12=50000>>50000 per month.
The engagement ring will cost him 2 * $50000 = $<<2*50000=100000>>100000.
This means that it will take Lee $100000 / $1000 = <<100000/1000=100>>100 months to save enough money before he can propose.
#### 100

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 5000, not 50000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
